sen.j: 安倍文殊院(あべもんじゅいん)は奈良県桜井市にある華厳宗の寺院である。
sen.e: Abemonju-in is a Kegon-shu sect temple in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.
Abemonju-in Temple is a temple of the Kegon sect in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 文法を直しました。指示書に従い表現を直しました。
sen.e: Abemonju-in Temple is a temple of the Kegon sect in Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は安倍山。
sen.e: Sango is Abesan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Abe-san.
sen.cmt: 統一用語を使用しました。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Abe-san.

sen.j: 本尊は文殊菩薩。
sen.e: Honzon is Monju Bosatsu.
Its honzon (the principal image of Buddha) is Monju Bosatsu.
Its honzon (the principal image of Buddha) is Monju Bosatsu.

sen.j: 開基（創立者）は阿倍内麻呂（あべのくらはしまろ）である。
sen.e: Kaiki (founder) was ABE no Kurahashimaro.
The kaiki (a founder) is ABE no Kurahashimaro.
The kaiki (a founder) is ABE no Kurahashimaro.

sen.j: 智恩寺 (宮津市)（京都府宮津市）・大聖寺 (高畠町)（山形県高畠町）とともに日本三文殊に数えられる。
sen.e: Chion-ji Temple (Miyatsu City) (Miyatsu City, Kyoto Prefecture)
Along with Chion-ji Temple (Miyatsu City, Kyoto Prefecture) and Daisho-ji Temple (Takahata-machi, Yamagata Prefecture), it composes the Three Monju in Japan.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れがあります。()内の宮津市、高畠町の記述は重複して記載する必要はないと思われますので、一回のみ記載しました。
sen.e: Along with Chion-ji Temple (Miyatsu City, Kyoto Prefecture) and Daisho-ji Temple (Takahata-machi, Yamagata Prefecture), it composes the Three Monju in Japan.

sen.j: 宗教法人としての公称は文殊院である。
sen.e: The nominal name of religious institution is Monjuin.
The official name as a religious corporation is Monju-in.
sen.cmt: 文法、単語を修正しました。
sen.e: The official name as a religious corporation is Monju-in.

sen.j: 大化の改新の時に左大臣として登用された安倍倉梯麻呂（あべのくらはしまろ）の氏寺として建立されたという。
sen.e: It was constructed as an Ujidera (family temple) for ABE no Kurahashimaro who was assigned as Minister of the left in the Taika Reformation.
It was constructed as an uji-dera temple (a temple built to pray for clan's glory) for ABE no Kurahashimaro who was assigned as Minister of the left in the Taika Reformation.
sen.cmt: 「氏寺」の表記、説明を用語集掲載の訳を参考に、補足、修正しました。
sen.e: It was constructed as an uji-dera temple (a temple built to pray for clan's glory) for ABE no Kurahashimaro who was assigned as Minister of the left in the Taika Reformation.

sen.j: 創建当時の寺地は現在の文殊院の西南300メートルほどのところであり、鎌倉時代に現在地に移された。
sen.e: At the time of its construction, the temple was located 300 metre south west of modern Monju-in Temple and it was relocated in the Kamakura period.
At the time of its construction, the temple was located 300 meters southwest of present Monju-in Temple, but it was relocated in the current place in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 若干訳漏れがあり（現在地に）、補足しました。Meterの綴りを採用しました。文法も若干修正しました。
sen.e: At the time of its construction, the temple was located 300 meters southwest of present Monju-in Temple, but it was relocated in the current place in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 旧寺地（桜井市安倍木材団地1丁目）は「安倍寺跡」として国の史跡に指定され、史跡公園として整備されている。
sen.e: The old location (1 chome Abemokuzaidanchi, Sakurai City) is an historical ruins park designated as a national historical site of 'Abedera ato.'
The old location (1-chome Abemokuzaidanchi, Sakurai City) is designated as a national historic site, called 'Abe-dera Ato (the site of Abe-dera Temple),' and kept as a historic park.
sen.cmt: 若干文法ミスがあり（冠詞）、修正しました。「史跡公園」の訳としてhistoric parkを採用しました（用語集参考）。
sen.e: The old location (1-chome Abemokuzaidanchi, Sakurai City) is designated as a national historic site, called 'Abe-dera Ato (the site of Abe-dera Temple),' and kept as a historic park.

sen.j: 発掘調査の結果、安倍寺は東（右）に金堂、西（左）に塔が建つ法隆寺式伽藍日本の伽藍をもっていたことがわかり、出土した古瓦の様式年代からも創建が7世紀にさかのぼる寺院跡であると見られる。
sen.e: As a result of excavation research, it was discovered that the Abedera Temple owned the Buddhist monastery of Horyu-ji Temple style where a tower is built in the west (the left) and golden hall in the east (the right), and it is considered to be the temple ruins of which the construction is in the seventh century from its old tile style's time.

As a result of the excavation, it was discovered that Abe-dera Temple used to have a Buddhist monastery in the Horyu-ji Temple style in which a tower was built in the west (the left) and a golden hall in the east (the right), and on analysis of the style used in the old tiles excavated at the site, it is considered to have been founded in the 7th century.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス（冠詞、関係代名詞等）及び分かりづらい表現があり、修正しました。
sen.e: As a result of the excavation, it was discovered that Abe-dera Temple used to have a Buddhist monastery in the Horyu-ji Temple style in which a tower was built in the west (the left) and a golden hall in the east (the right), and on analysis of the style used in the old tiles excavated at the site, it is considered to have been founded in the 7th century.

sen.j: 「東大寺要録」巻6には、東大寺の末寺の1つである「崇敬寺」が安倍倉梯麻呂の建立であることと、「崇敬寺」の別名が「安倍寺」であったことが記載されている。
sen.e: In 'Todaiji Yoroku' Volume 6, it is mentioned that "崇敬寺 Temple" which is one of the subordinate temples of Todaiji Temple being constructed by ABE no Kurahashimaro and that its other name was "Abedera Temple."

In the 6th volume of 'Todai-ji Yoroku (the Digest Records of Todai-ji Temple),' it is mentioned that '崇敬寺 Temple,' a branch temple of Todai-ji Temple, was founded by ABE no Kurahashimaro and that it was also known as 'Abe-dera Temple.'
sen.cmt: 文法、及び表現ミスあり、修正しました。東大寺要録の説明を補いました。崇敬寺の読み方は不明です。
sen.e: In the 6th volume of 'Todai-ji Yoroku (the Digest Records of Todai-ji Temple),' it is mentioned that '崇敬寺 Temple,' a branch temple of Todai-ji Temple, was founded by ABE no Kurahashimaro and that it was also known as 'Abe-dera Temple.'

sen.j: 当院では陰陽師・安倍晴明が陰陽道の修行をしたともいわれ、2000年（平成12年）には安倍晴明堂が建立されている。
sen.e: It is said that Onmyoji (Yin Yang fortune-teller) ABE no Seimei trained his ascetic practices of the Yin Yang method in this temple, and in 2000 ABE no Seimei hall was erected.

It is said that Onmyoji (the master of Yin Yang) ABE no Seimei trained himself in the way of Yin and Yang (the occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) in this temple, and in 2000 ABE no Seimei Hall was erected.
sen.cmt: 陰陽師、陰陽道の説明を用語集上の役を元に追加、修正しました。若干表現を修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that Onmyoji (the master of Yin Yang) ABE no Seimei trained himself in the way of Yin and Yang (the occult divination system based on the Taoist theory of the five elements) in this temple, and in 2000 ABE no Seimei Hall was erected.

sen.e: It is the golden Rokkakudo (hexagonal hall) erected in the Monju pond in 1985, and ABE no Nakamaro and ABE no Seimei are enshrined.
It is the golden Rokkakudo (a hexagonal hall) erected in the Monju pond in 1985, where the statues of ABE no Nakamaro and ABE no Seimei are enshrined.

sen.e: Nagarezukuri Kokerabuki architecture constructed in the late Muromachi period, and is known as the god of marriage.
It is a shingle-roofed building in the Nagare-zukuri style constructed in the late Muromachi period and known to enshrine the god of marriage.
sen.cmt: 主語が抜けているので補いました。流造杮葺の説明を補足しました。また、文後半はこのままでは意味が成り立たないので、「縁結びの神が祀られていることで知られる」として訳しました。
sen.e: It is a shingle-roofed building in the Nagare-zukuri style constructed in the late Muromachi period and known to enshrine the god of marriage.

sen.j: 本堂近くにある7世紀中頃の古墳で、豪族安倍（阿倍）氏一族の墓であることはほぼ確実視され、安倍倉梯麻呂の墓であるともいわれる。
sen.e: This is an ancient burial mound from 7th century located near the main hall, it almost certainly belonged to local ruling ABE family, and it is also said it has the tomb of ABE no Kurahashimaro.

This is an ancient burial mound from the 7th century located near the hondo, and it was almost verified that it is the tomb which belonged to the Abe clan, a local ruling family, and some opinions hold that it is the tomb of ABE no Kurahashimaro.
sen.cmt: 文法ミスあり、修正しました。
sen.e: This is an ancient burial mound from the 7th century located near the hondo, and it was almost verified that it is the tomb which belonged to the Abe clan, a local ruling family, and some opinions hold that it is the tomb of ABE no Kurahashimaro.

sen.j: 古墳の原状は不明だが、径25メートルほどの円墳であったと見られる。
sen.e: The current status of this kofun (ancient burial mound) is unknown, but it is speculated that it was a burial mound of 25m in diameter.
The original status of this kofun (ancient burial mound) is unknown, but it is speculated that it was a burial mound of 25m in diameter.

sen.e: The original status of this kofun (ancient burial mound) is unknown, but it is speculated that it was a burial mound of 25m in diameter.

sen.j: 巨大な獅子にまたがる総高約７ｍもある文殊菩薩像を4体の脇侍像が取り囲む文殊五尊像である。
sen.e: The Monju 5 sculptures consist of Monju Bosatsu Buddha on a gigantic 7 metre high lion accompanied by 4 guards.
It is Monju Gosonzo (the Monju quintet) composed of the 7-meter-high statue of Monju Bosatsu riding on a gigantic lion and the statues of four flanking attendants.
sen.cmt: 誤訳（日本語解釈ミス）があり、直しました。7Mはライオンではなく像全体の高さを示すものでしょう。
sen.e: It is Monju Gosonzo (the Monju quintet) composed of the 7-meter-high statue of Monju Bosatsu riding on a gigantic lion and the statues of four flanking attendants.

sen.j: 文殊五尊像の脇侍は普通、善財童子、ウダヤナ、最勝老人、仏陀波利三蔵と呼ばれるが、文殊院では「最勝老人」にあたる像を「維摩居士」、仏陀波利三蔵にあたる像を「須菩提」と称している。
sen.e: The 4 guards are usually called Zenzaidouji (Bosatsu), Udayana, Saishorojin and Butsudaharisanzo, however, in Monjuin, the statue equivalent to 'Saishorojin' is called 'Yuimakoji' and another one equivalent to Butsudaharisanzo is called 'Subodai.'

Usually, four attendants in the Monju quintet are called Zenzai-doji (Sudhana), Udayana, Saisho-rojin and Butsudahari-sanzo; however, in Monju-in Temple, the statue equivalent to 'Saisho-rojin' is called 'Yuima-koji (Vimalakirti Sutra)' and the one equivalent to Butsudahari-sanzo is called 'Subodai (Subhuti).'
sen.cmt: ローマ字表記ミス、文法ミスを直しました。「善財童子」はZenzaidoji (Sudhana)としました。
sen.e: Usually, four attendants in the Monju quintet are called Zenzai-doji (Sudhana), Udayana, Saisho-rojin and Butsudahari-sanzo; however, in Monju-in Temple, the statue equivalent to 'Saisho-rojin' is called 'Yuima-koji (Vimalakirti Sutra)' and the one equivalent to Butsudahari-sanzo is called 'Subodai (Subhuti).'

sen.j: 維摩居士像は後世の補作である。

The statue of Yuima-koji was supplemented afterward.
sen.cmt: 読み誤りあり。「維摩居士」は「Yuimagoji」です。「像」の意が抜けているので補足。

sen.j: 拝観料、絵馬奉納、お守り、祈祷料などの支払いを、本堂に設置された読み取り端末に電子マネーカードや携帯電話（おサイフケータイ）をかざすことで現金を使わず行うことができる。

The payment for the admission fee, Ema (a pictorial offering) dedication, amulets, the prayer fee, etc. can be made not only by cash but by electronic money cards or the Osaifu-Ketai system of mobile phones (the de facto standard mobile payment system in Japan) through the read sensor set in the hondo.
